name: AC Hotel Carlton Madrid by Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Madrid before our check in time and we were extremely jetlagged. The desk staff made check in easy and fast and we were napping in no time. Our airline lost our bags and we are not fluent in Spanish, but the desk staff took it upon themselves to make inquiries on our behalf. The hotel is conveniently located near Atocha (the main train station) and is a short walk from downtown. The staff was so fantastic and helpful during our entire stay! At the end of our trip (we covered 7 cities) we stayed there again and were recognized as having stayed already! They really are spectacular at Hotel Carlton. Alfonso Lopez was amazing with giving directions and recommending places to check out. He also helped us the most with locating our luggage, although we never did receive it while on our trip.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located for easy access to all Madrid locations. Hotel staff very pleasant and drinks in the cafe bar were reasonably priced although the food was a lot cheaper in other eating establishments around the area . NYE was amazing in the SOL area the atmosphere was electric!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyone who is arriving at Barajas airport the easiest way to get to the hotel is via the metro from the airport to Nuevos Ministerios then changing onto the RENFE which is the train that leaves platform 2 and stops at the Atocha station when you leave the station the hotel is a 5 min walk and only costs 3 euros as opposed to 37 euros in a taxi.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definately recommend Madrid to everyone
reviews.title: Excellent city hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located 2 blocks south of El Prado and a 15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor. The staff was excellent and accomodating. The hotel must have been renovated recently as the large rooms were totally modernized with brand new bathrooms, hardwood floors and huge flatpanel tv's. The hotel is on a main street so definitely ask for a room on a high floor in the back of the hotel. The breakfast was outstanding. An excellent value for the price.
reviews.title: Everything was Just Right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the Thanksgiving holiday in Madrid and found the Carlton Hotel to be a good value. Located close to the Atocha train station and the Prado (5 min. walking distance), the hotel is a good value for the money. 2 supermarkets are within walking distance. The hotel was clean and the staff nice and helpful. We couldn't exchange money at the desk (they sent us to a bank). The rooms are clean but there is no coffee maker. Internet connection is very expensive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but very noisy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main issue is its location, right on a busy boulevard which means lots of noise from the traffic and constant honking and sirens. If I'd stay again at this hotel, I'd make sure to ask for a high floor and not facing the Paseo Delicias.
reviews.title: Great location, great room, traffic very noisy.
Close to art museums.
reviews.text: We are just back from a long weekend at the Carlton. Really enjoyed the city and the hotel.

On the positive side the hotel is in a great location for getting around. Just on the southern edge of the city Atocha station is a couple of 100m away, so easy access to the Metro (which is fantastic). Three main galleries are all in walking distance.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at an excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was recently refurbished to an excellent standard, it was faultless. There were no bathrobes or tea making facilities which was a bit of a disappointment as they were shown on the web site, but apparently for suites only.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not in the best part of town the hotel is only a 10 to 15 minute walk to where it all happens. At 80€ a night it was excellent value for Madrid. The bedroom and en-suite bathroom were HUGE and very well appointed and the staff were very helpful. Can't comment on the breakfast as we had an early departure but in all other respects you won't regret staying here.
reviews.title: You won't regret staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious and clean - but 2 single beds put together to make a double was annoying. Was also allocated a smoking room in a lower floor despite requesting a non-smoking upper room. Would also expect tea/coffee maker in a 4-star hotel. On the plus side, the hotel had a very good location, especially for the art galleries. Enjoyed very much our short stay in Madrid.
reviews.title: Good location, but room could have been better

reviews.text: I stayed here at both the beginning and end of my last trip to Spain and wish I had known about this hotel for previous trips. Got a great night sleep every night in the peaceful, spotless room. Staff were friendly, helpful, and very professional. Most importantly to me, the location is ideal for walking to everything I want access to: museums, gardens, train station, metro. This is an all-around great hotel, very comfortable, but not at all pretentious, reasonably priced for Madrid.
reviews.title: I’ll always stay here when I’m in Madrid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an avid reader of tripadvisor reviews before booking anywhere I was encouraged by the tone of the reviews I read. I was not disapointed by the Hotel though I would say that it was a superior 3 star rather than a 4 star. For a city that supposedly never sleeps the Hotel Bar, basically part of the restuarent, closed at 11.30.
reviews.title: Carlton is a good unpretentious hotel worth a visit if you have to go to Madrid.
Clean and Comfortable
reviews.text: Having read the reviews we contacted the hotel by email after booking to ask for a room on a higher floor in a quiet location. We got exactly what we asked for, room 706. Would reccomend this room, see photos we have posted, as it was at the corner of the building on the top floor. It was large, had a huge double bed, and semed to have been relatively recently refurbished. It had everything that you could ask for including a mini bar, that was useful to empty and fill with water etc purchased from the supermarket 50 yards away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is seems pretty basic for a 4-star hotel, but it is well-maintained and clean. The 'double' bed is actually two single beds pushed together. The TV is a small (old black-box style) and turns off by itself for no reason.
reviews.title: Good value, prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is best part - it is a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Atoche).
reviews.title: nice, but not gracious. very thin walls could hear noise of others

reviews.text: Internet is extra; 9EUR for an hour.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel for a solo woman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Safe in the room is extra; 2EUR a day
reviews.title: Fine hotel, just leave my AC alone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is helpful and curteous.
reviews.title: Great Location
